email.text:
Women in Computing are really pleased to announce that we are launching **Women in Computing Entrepreneurs (WiCE)**, a scheme within DoC with the intent of promoting, supporting and encouraging female entrepreneurship by providing information, regular talks and mentorships to both students and staff who are curious about setting up their own business. To find out more, check out the [WiCE website](http://wic.doc.ic.ac.uk/wice).
Read on for details on our inaugural WiCE event: **The Hesitant Entrepreneur**!

Becoming your own boss does not fit your personality or lifestyle? The data shows that this choice is largely influenced by society and less of a personal choice.
Join Women in Computing for a talk where we will explore not only the biases that society holds that prevent women entrepreneurs to grow, but more importantly what prevents women from starting their own businesses in the first place. Throughout this talk, you might discover there is in fact an entrepreneur within you, and how you can become empowered to challenge the existing norm and create your own business.
This talk will be given by Dr Maria Vigliotti, a former academic at the Department of Computing at Imperial College London. Maria has worked with several start-ups, and now runs Sandblocks Consulting, a boutique consultancy specialising in blockchain technology and cybersecurity.
Make sure to [**register on Eventbrite**](https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/the-hesitant-entrepreneur-tickets-151089026345) and submit any questions for Maria in advance to [this Google form](https://forms.gle/B3zVFePPBSsCzNZ39). Hope to see you there!
